alert.note: Alert for City of Williamsburg; Gloucester; James City; York (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 16 at 1:39PM EDT until July 16 at 4:45PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: The National Weather Service in Wakefield has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... South Central Gloucester County in southeastern Virginia... James City County in southeastern Virginia... Northwestern York County in southeastern Virginia... The City of Williamsburg in southeastern Virginia... * Until 445 PM EDT. * At 139 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. The expected rainfall rate is 2 to 4 inches in 1 hour. Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Newport News, Williamsburg, College Of William And Mary, Queens Lake, Kings Point, York Terrace, Carver Gardens, Busch Gardens, Grove, Jamestown, Williamsburg Airport, Water Country U.S.A., Camp Peary, Centerville, U.s. Naval Weapons, Governors Land and Clay Bank. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...2-4 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

area.areaDesc: City of Williamsburg; Gloucester; James City; York
